alert.note: Alert for Banks; Barrow; Cobb; DeKalb; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 29 at 11:42PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Barrow, northwestern DeKalb, southern Cobb, Gwinnett, southwestern Banks, southern Hall, northwestern Jackson and central Fulton Counties through 1215 AM EST... At 1142 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Cumming to near Johns Creek to near Hiram, and moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, pea sized hail and frequent cloud to ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Atlanta, Marietta, Gainesville, Lawrenceville, Decatur, Winder, Jefferson, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Smyrna, Dunwoody, Duluth, Sugar Hill, Suwanee, Buford, Lilburn, Chamblee, Norcross, Doraville and Clarkston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EST for north central and northeastern Georgia.

area.areaDesc: Banks; Barrow; Cobb; DeKalb; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson
